notes.note: To be placed on the waitlist please contact Danielle Dean-Manzer at dyd1@cornell.edu.

Only Communication majors and CALS students can enroll online. If unable to enroll, you must attend the lecture you want to add the first day of classes, but this does not guarantee enrollment. Communication majors and CALS seniors will have priority. For questions, contact Danielle at DYD1@cornell.edu.

Enrollment is limited to COMM majors. Prerequisite: COMM 1101; 6 college writing courses.
Prerequisite: six college writing credits or junior standing.
Prerequisite: COMM 1101.
Enrollment is limited to: juniors, seniors, or grad students. College-level writing course.

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Writing and Editing for Magazines and Online Media

notes.note: Enrollment is limited to: juniors or seniors. Prerequisite: COMM 2310 or equivalent. Preference given to COMM majors. Laptop required.

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Writing and Editing for Magazines and Online Media

notes.note: Enrollment is limited to: juniors or seniors. Prerequisite: COMM 2310 or equivalent. Preference given to COMM majors. Laptop required.

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Communication and Decision Making in Groups

notes.note: Prerequsite or co-register: COMM 2760. Enrollment is limited to: juniors or seniors. Preference given to COMM majors.
Prerequisite: COMM/STS 3520, ENGRC 3500 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite or co-register: COMM 2820 or equivalent, social research course, and one semester of introductory statistics.
Enrollment is limited to: juniors or seniors or present or past undergraduate teaching assistant for COMM course. Class taught on alternate Monday's.
Prerequisite: COMM 1101 or permission of instructor. Enrollment is limited to: juniors, seniors, or graduate students.
Enrollment is limited to: juniors, seniors, or graduate students or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: COMM/INFO 3450 or permission of instructor.
Taught at 301 College Ave.
Enrollment is limited to: COMM majors or minors.
Prerequisite: 3.0 GPA. Students must register using independent study form (available in 140 Roberts Hall).

Prerequisite: 3.0 GPA (2.7 if teaching assistant for skills development course). Enrollment limited to: juniors or seniors. Enrollment preference given to: undergraduates desiring classroom teaching experience. Students must register using independent study form (available in 140 Roberts Hall).
Prerequisite: 3.0 GPA. Enrollment limited to: senior standing. Students must register using independent study form (available in 140 Roberts Hall).

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Independent Honors Research in Social Science
course.class_descr: Ind Honors Res in Soc Science

notes.note: Prerequisite: requirements met for honors program. Enrollment limited to: undergraduate students. Enrollment preference given to: students pursuing the research honors thesis in Communication. Students must complete the CALS Honors program application by the third week of the fall semester of their senior year. Students should select a faculty advisor and begin proposal development during their junior year.
Enrollment limited to: graduate students. The class will be offered 4-6 March, all day.
Prerequisite: intro research methods course and intro psychology or social psychology course.
Enrollment limited to: graduate students.
Prerequisite: COMM 6800 or graduate standing. Permission of instructor is required.
Prerequisite: COMM 6820. Enrollment limited to: graduate students.
Taught at 301 College Ave.

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Structural Equation Modeling in Social Science Research
